case_vignette: A 25-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 4-day history of bloody stools! During this time, he has not had nausea, vomiting, abdominal cramps, or pain while defecating! He has had recurrent episodes of non-bloody diarrhea for the past 6 months! His father died of colon cancer at the age of 39 years! His vital signs are within normal limits! Physical examination shows small, painless bony swellings on the mandible, forehead, and right shin! There are multiple non-tender, subcutaneous nodules with central black pores present over the trunk and face! Fundoscopic examination shows multiple, oval, darkly pigmented lesions on the retina! Colonoscopy shows approximately 150 colonic polyps!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Familial adenomatous polyposis with Gardner syndrome

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having bloody stools for the past 4 days.
Have you experienced any other symptoms like abdominal pain, diarrhea, or weight loss?
I have not had abdominal pain or weight loss, but I've had recurrent episodes of non-bloody diarrhea for the past 6 months.
Do you have a history of any chronic inflammatory diseases or autoimmune conditions?
No, I do not have a history of chronic inflammatory diseases or autoimmune conditions.
Have you been taking any new medications or antibiotics recently?
No, I have not been taking any new medications or antibiotics recently.
Do you have a family history of gastrointestinal diseases, such as inflammatory bowel disease or colorectal cancer?
Yes, my father died of colon cancer at the age of 39.
Final Diagnosis: Colorectal cancer
